I love this airport. Apart from the 'coming home' feeling, it has been one of the best airports in terms of cleanliness, design and ease of operations as a traveler. Having travelled internationally, I always feel proud when I pass Bengaluru Airport. Good job! keep going
Awesome Airport, Nice ambience , Better connectivity,

Dear BLR Airport,
My experiences are always pleasant except today. Due to huge delay at the security check in, I missed by scheduled flight by 10 mins. With more than 100 passengers at the same time, only 2 counters were open. No ground staff to help or reach to. I was bound to pay 1000 bucks extra for the next flight again.
Can I have some explanation for my fault here? Despite reaching 1.5 hrs before time, I was hecled early in the morning, without any justification from airline's or KIAL's end. I wish to have justice about the same. I wish to have my money refunded immediately. It may not be a matter of money, but a settlement must be reached.
Atmaja
excellent, nice connectivity

We complain a lot about the condition of public toilets in India (certainly with good reason). But have you seen toilet cleaning staff welcome you with "Namaskara"?
Yes, it happens in Kempegowda International Airport in Bangalore. Munianjaneyappa takes care of one of the toilets and he keeps his domain sparklingly clean, welcomes every user, guides them to the facilities. When you are about to leave he even wishes you "happy journey" (My wife tells me it's the same great service in the Ladies' too. A big thank you to Munianjaneyappa and his colleagues and the authorities.
easy access and good service.

I have been a regular stopper-by at the Bangalore International airport - but lately, i have some of my friends (who are foreigners) who have been harrasssed by some of the officials at the airport - ridiculing their beliefs, etc. If this persists, no foreigner will be interested to land in Bangalore via air-craft. Pls do the needful to rectify the issue the soonest.

It is pure religious discrimination and hatred. Another had to meet an immigration officer in a seperate room who questioned her although she had the right papers and treathened to make it really hard for anyone from USA to enter India. Is this how the airport wants to tread spiritual tourists from the West?????!!!

I was sexually harassed by Immigration Officers while leaving India. The officers whose station I went through started to laugh when he saw I was wearing a mala with Nithyanandaji's picture on it, and told me to wait. He took my passport and went to another security officer, then another, then another. Finally, to my horror, ALL the security officers came to the booth where I was waiting, leering, looking me up and down, laughing and talking in the local language. Finally, on...e of them asked me in English, "How many times has your guru touched you?" I told them never. Then another asked, "Did he ever try to touch you under your clothes?" I said no. They all kept laughing and I could see by their expressions they were imagining all kind of gross things about me. I felt like I couldn't fight back because they have weapons and they were holding my passport. I just wanted to go home to Canada after a beautiful time in India, but these rascals made my homeward journey scary and humiliating. I will never leave India from Bengaluru International again. I've come here 9 times, and have never had this problem in any airport but Bengaluru.

One of the best airports and I don‚Äôt say it‚Äô because it‚Äôs home . Friendly staff and so convenient , it‚Äôs also extremely efficient . Immigration is also fast and it‚Äôs a pleasure to fly in and out of this airport

I was being Questioned and Harassed about why Chose my Guru how did get to know him for what reason im going to him so many questions that are not needed just because of the opinion they have over the media and not the Reality

My last journey was horrible, missed my hand watch in the rest room, while hand washing and forget to took back. After came out immediately I realised my watch is missed. Suddenly I went to gate security they denied to get in back, then I asked him how to get my watch back- NOBODY EXPLAINED ME. He asked me go to INDIGO customers care, again they asked me to go LOST AND FOUND, again then they asked me to go to CISF, finally cisf asked me wait at GATE 13 for 10 minutes. Almos...t waited for 1 hour no response. Some how the gate security helped me to check with rest room cleaner, and came to know that my watch had already handover to CISF. Again I went to CISF, offices were very busy in talking themselves, not even bother to attend. When I asked he said to wait again, I replied how Long - the answer he said is he has only one officer and it will take time. I thought myself ‚Äú CISF also running short staff‚Äù. Then again went back to gate 13 and waited another 30 min.another officer in the next gate called me and asked to go the CISF senior officer @gate 9. Finally I senior officer in gate 9 helped me to get the watch. I also. Thanked him. After 2 hours running to both ends of airport for atleast 8 times I got my watch.

My in laws took a cab at Bengaluru Airport on 8th Sep 2017. The driver said he will go by meter. The driver charged them wrong for a distance of 49 km. The total amount is 1964 + 225 for toll (total 2189). The vehicle number is KA43 5420. I travel regularly on this route and never been amount greater than 1000-1200. The distance travelled was 49 kms-101 mins. I have sent repeated mails to feedback-bialairportcom but it‚Äôs been 3 days and they have not responded. Please take action against this vehicle and its owner.

I had a very bad experience travelling through the Bangalore airport. I had a long layover at the Bangalore airport before taking the flight to London. I had to literally beg to the CISF to let me out and get in since there is no eatery in the waiting area except for CCD.
Secondly,the day use hotel was under renovation on 3rd July and the Premium lounge could be accessed only after the immigration which was not possible so early. Neither the immigration authorities,nor the airport staff was helpful enough to grant me access to the VIP waiting lounge. Seems like you don‚Äôt want to treat customers well.

A major bug bear for me is how gender discrimination is extended even to the airport. The women's security queues are a mile long with only 1 or 2 stations where as the men's queues are a breeze through with 7-8 stations.
Another problem is when staff send you from the main queue to form 'little queues' behind people checking in so they can breathe down the people in front's necks!
That is seriously annoying.
Hope the airport looks at other major airports and learns.

More security passages for women! Having 3 female lanes and 15 or so male lanes is obviously going to lead to an inefficient system. Even if there were fewer females flying in this day and age, having less than a 60:40 does not make sense. Every female that passes through Bengaluru airport requests you to increase the security check lanes for females - to atleast 7-8 lanes. Would make for a much better and easier (efficient) experience.

My friends and devotees of Paramahamsa Nithyananda have faced harassment at the airport during this past week. 4 people were denied access to the country although all have visas present and are tourists and seekers.

Another one has faced verbal abuse and was asked where, how her Guru was touching her. Can airport authorities look into what is going on the airport? I and my friends will be definitely seeking a legal advice and avoid Bengaluru airport. Shame that one of the true voices of Hinduism and his devotees are being harassed.

Hi my name is Anju, I was traveling in the enervates flight to dubai and then to hear grow London and ultimately to Shannon Ireland by Aer lingus on the 31st dec 2019, I have a residence permit from Ireland , I do not hav a valid Uk visa, as per the govt of Uk website if I do hav valid air tickets on the same day of departure , I am
Allowed a transit as long as I leave the same day as I arrive .. instead of being aware or checking in the small book as they did in Dubai airpor...t they kept asking for my work permit which completely unrequited as I have a residence permit, I would have even provided it but the internet was not connection when told so Mr Tony Christopher said it‚Äôs my problem the staff was completely rude and silly with no rational behind their quest and they were so clueless instead of contacting the correct authority they kept calling them selves .. I even showed them Heathrow immigration stamps from feb 2019 where in I was allowed to enter and exist without a visa because of my residence .. but to no avail I told them multiple times I travel twice a year from Bangalore to Ireland the same way but they refuse to listen and were persistent on checking .. the limit was when they said Gatwick airport in London aloes transfer but they are unaware of Heathrow .. as per me this common sense if it is allowed in one airport in London it should be allowed in the others .. I was meant ally harresed and after paying a lakh and seven thousand as my ticket price made to wait for more than an hour here and there and traumatized I told them I will go and if they deport me I will deal with it .. as I have landed in Ireland I hav not been deported .. the Emirates ground staff and Mr Tony Christopher are totally incompetent and rude people .. I will be raising this on various platforms till I get a satisfactory response ..

World class airport !! But the people and processes which defies logic is mind boggling. Good Evening Friends.
I had a very horrible experience at
the Kempe gowda International Airport.
I had come back from Singapore yesterday night at 12.30 am.I had booked a Ola cab
and cancelled it because of misunderstanding the location of pick-up point.The Airport Authority had given the pickup point for Ola at some stupid place which is around 300 metres away from the regular pickup. Why this nonsense thing has to happen and put the passengers to walk with luggage and chi...ldren for 300 metres?
Who is the bloody stupid mind behind this nonsense?

What's behind the absolutely ridiculous decision to disallow Uber cabs from picking people up from the designated pick up points along the curb??? So you want passengers to suffer a heatstroke while walking a kilometer to a demarcated parking lot for Uber? Can it get more painful than that? What's next - walk to Devanhalli if we're using Uber?? Stop catering to your own inefficient and overpriced cab cartel and be empathetic to passengers. It's our choice whether we want to use Uber or not, so don't be malicious and try to force your preferences upon us!

Looted at Kempegowda airport by the security staff.This happened to my mother during security check to board Air India flight to Kochi on 11th April 2016.They took her handbag to check for a non existent nail cutter and returned the bag.On the flgh she found five 1000 rupee notes and 2 wristwatches missing. Pleae watch out for these crooks in Police clothing in Kempegowda Airport Bangalore and other airports as well. They prey on unsuspecting senior citizens.
